org.ngi

Class Bounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ngi.Bounds
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Bounds
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Bounding box class for 2d objects. Uses Min and Max X,Y values to define a region.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Bounds other)
        Test if this Bounds contains another Bounds.
        Parameters:
        other - Bounds to test.
        Returns:
        True if this Bounds contains another Bounds, false otherwise.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Bounds other,
                        float proximity)
        Test if this Bounds contains another bounds with a proximity setting. The Bounds can be within the proximity to another.
        Parameters:
        other - Bounds to test.
        proximity - Proximity distance to other Bounds.
        Returns:
        True if Bounds is within this bounds with proximity applied.

        Expand to include another Bounds. This is the Union between two bounds.
        Parameters:
        other - Bounds to union with.

        public float aspectRatio()
        Get the aspect ratio of the bounds.
        Returns:

      • getQuadrantNW

        public Bounds getQuadrantNW()
        Get the sub-bonds from the min x and min y to the center. In screen coordinates this is the North West quadrant.
        Returns:
        The Bounds covering the NW quadrant.

      • getQuadrantNE

        public Bounds getQuadrantNE()
        Get the sub-bonds from the center x and min y to the center/right. In screen coordinates this is the North East quadrant.
        Returns:
        The Bounds covering the NE quadrant.

      • getQuadrantSW

        public Bounds getQuadrantSW()
        Get the sub-bonds from the min x and center y to the bottom/center. In screen coordinates this is the South West quadrant.
        Returns:
        The Bounds covering the SW quadrant.

      • getQuadrantSE

        public Bounds getQuadrantSE()
        Get the sub-bonds from the center x and center y to the bottom/right. In screen coordinates this is the South East quadrant.
        Returns:
        The Bounds covering the SE quadrant.

        public void translate(float x,
                      float y)

        Parameters:
